table.name: business_type_code
table.remarks: A code indicating the business type of a client. It could be either Registered Business and Unregistered Business.

column.name: business_type_code
column.remarks: A code indicating the business type of a client.

column.name: description
column.remarks: The description of the code value.

column.name: effective_date
column.remarks: The date that the code value has become or is expected to become effective. Default is the data that the code value is created.

column.name: expiry_date
column.remarks: The date on which the code value has expired or is expected to expire. Default 9999-12-31.

column.name: create_timestamp
column.remarks: The date and time the record was created.

column.name: update_timestamp
column.remarks: The date and time the record was created or last updated.

column.name: create_user
column.remarks: The user or proxy account that created the record.

column.name: update_user
column.remarks: The user or proxy account that created or last updated the record.

table.name: client_type_code
table.remarks: A code indicating the type of a client. Examples include, but are not limited to: Corporation, Individual, Association, and others.

column.name: client_type_code
column.remarks: A code representing the type of a client.

column.name: description
column.remarks: The description of the code value.

column.name: effective_date
column.remarks: The date that the code value has become or is expected to become effective. Default is the data that the code value is created.

column.name: expiry_date
column.remarks: The date on which the code value has expired or is expected to expire. Default 9999-12-31.

column.name: create_timestamp
column.remarks: The date and time the record was created.

column.name: update_timestamp
column.remarks: The date and time the record was created or last updated.

column.name: create_user
column.remarks: The user or proxy account that created the record.

column.name: update_user
column.remarks: The user or proxy account that created or last updated the record.

table.name: contact_type_code
table.remarks: A code indicating the role of a contact of a client.

column.name: contact_type_code
column.remarks: A code representing the code of a role of a client's contact.

column.name: description
column.remarks: The description of the code value.

column.name: effective_date
column.remarks: The date that the code value has become or is expected to become effective. Default is the data that the code value is created.

column.name: expiry_date
column.remarks: The date on which the code value has expired or is expected to expire. Default 9999-12-31.

column.name: create_timestamp
column.remarks: The date and time the record was created.

column.name: update_timestamp
column.remarks: The date and time the record was created or last updated.

column.name: create_user
column.remarks: The user or proxy account that created the record.

column.name: update_user

table.name: country_code
table.remarks: A list of countries, serving as a reference for country-specific data.

column.name: country_code
column.remarks: A code representing the code of a country.

column.name: description
column.remarks: The description of the code value.

column.name: effective_date
column.remarks: The date that the code value has become or is expected to become effective. Default is the data that the code value is created.

column.name: expiry_date
column.remarks: The date on which the code value has expired or is expected to expire. Default 9999-12-31.

column.name: display_order
column.remarks: The the display order of a country. If no value is provided, the application will order countries alphabetically by default.

column.name: create_timestamp
column.remarks: The date and time the record was created.

column.name: update_timestamp
column.remarks: The date and time the record was created or last updated.

column.name: create_user
column.remarks: The user or proxy account that created the record.

column.name: update_user
column.remarks: The user or proxy account that created or last updated the record.

table.name: district_code
table.remarks: A list of Natural Resource Districts.

column.name: district_code
column.remarks: A code representing the code of a Natural Resource District.

column.name: description
column.remarks: The description of the code value.

column.name: email_address
column.remarks: The email address of the Natural Resource District.

column.name: effective_date
column.remarks: The date that the code value has become or is expected to become effective. Default is the data that the code value is created.

column.name: expiry_date
column.remarks: The date on which the code value has expired or is expected to expire. Default 9999-12-31.

column.name: create_timestamp
column.remarks: The date and time the record was created.

column.name: update_timestamp
column.remarks: The date and time the record was created or last updated.

column.name: create_user
column.remarks: The user or proxy account that created the record.

column.name: update_user
column.remarks: The user or proxy account that created or last updated the record.

column.name: email_log_id
column.remarks: Incremental id generated for a submission email log.

column.name: email_id
column.remarks: Identifier for the associated email assigned by CHES (if applicable).

column.name: email_sent_ind
column.remarks: Indicator for whether the email has been sent ('Y' for Yes, 'N' for No).

column.name: exception_message
column.remarks: Textual message describing any exceptions that occurred during email processing.

column.name: template_name
column.remarks: Name of the email template used for sending the email.

column.name: email_address
column.remarks: Email address to which the email is sent.

column.name: email_subject
column.remarks: Subject of the email.

column.name: email_variables
column.remarks: JSONB field to store variables related to the email content.

column.name: create_timestamp
column.remarks: Timestamp indicating when the email log entry was created.

column.name: update_timestamp
column.remarks: Timestamp indicating when the email log entry was last updated.

column.name: identification_type_code
column.remarks: A code indicating the identification type of a client. Examples of possible ID types include Canadian Birth Certificate, Canadian Passport, and others.

column.name: description
column.remarks: The description of the code value.

column.name: country_code
column.remarks: A code representing the country to which the ID type belongs. If the country code is populated, a province or state will be required.

column.name: effective_date
column.remarks: The date that the code value has become or is expected to become effective. Default is the data that the code value is created.

column.name: expiry_date
column.remarks: The date on which the code value has expired or is expected to expire. Default 9999-12-31.

column.name: create_timestamp
column.remarks: The date and time the record was created.

column.name: update_timestamp
column.remarks: The date and time the record was created or last updated.

column.name: create_user
column.remarks: The user or proxy account that created the record.

column.name: update_user
column.remarks: The user or proxy account that created or last updated the record.

table.name: province_code
table.remarks: A list of provinces, states, departments or territories, serving as a reference for province-specific data.

column.name: province_code
column.remarks: A code representing the code of a province, state, department or territory.

column.name: country_code
column.remarks: A code representing the country in which the province is located.

column.name: description
column.remarks: The description of the code value.

column.name: effective_date
column.remarks: The date that the code value has become or is expected to become effective. Default is the data that the code value is created.

column.name: expiry_date
column.remarks: The date on which the code value has expired or is expected to expire. Default 9999-12-31.

column.name: create_timestamp
column.remarks: The date and time the record was created.

column.name: update_timestamp
column.remarks: The date and time the record was created or last updated.

column.name: create_user
column.remarks: The user or proxy account that created the record.

column.name: update_user
column.remarks: The user or proxy account that created or last updated the record.

column.name: display_order
column.remarks: The the display order of a province/state. If no value is provided, the application will order provinces/states alphabetically by default.

table.name: submission
table.remarks: A submission request to create a client.

column.name: submission_id
column.remarks: Incremental id generated for a submission of a client.

column.name: submission_type_code
column.remarks: A code indicating the status of a submission request. Examples include, but are not limited to: New, Approved, Rejected, and others.

column.name: submission_date
column.remarks: The date and time the record was created.

column.name: update_timestamp
column.remarks: The date and time the record was created or last updated.

column.name: create_user
column.remarks: The user or proxy account that created the record.

column.name: update_user
column.remarks: The user or proxy account that created or last updated the record.

column.name: notify_client_ind
column.remarks: An indicator that determines whether the submission should be sent to the client.

table.name: submission_contact
table.remarks: The details of a contacts for each client's location.

column.name: submission_contact_id
column.remarks: Incremental id generated for the contact details of a client.

column.name: submission_id
column.remarks: Incremental id generated for a submission of a client.

column.name: contact_type_code
column.remarks: A code representing the code of a role of a client's contact.

column.name: first_name
column.remarks: The first name of the client's contact.

column.name: last_name
column.remarks: The last name of the client's contact.

column.name: business_phone_number
column.remarks: The phone number of the client's contact.

column.name: email_address
column.remarks: The email address of the client's contact.

column.name: idp_user_id
column.remarks: The unique identifier assigned to a user by the Identity Provider.

column.name: secondary_phone_number
column.remarks: A secondary phone number of the client's contact.

column.name: fax_number
column.remarks: The fax number of the client's contact.

table.name: submission_detail
table.remarks: The details of a submission request to create a client.

column.name: submission_detail_id
column.remarks: Incremental id generated for a submission detail of a client.

column.name: submission_id
column.remarks: Incremental id generated for a submission of a client.

column.name: business_type_code
column.remarks: A code indicating the business type of a client. It could be either Registered Business and Unregistered Business.

column.name: incorporation_number
column.remarks: A number provided to B.C. corporations, businesses or societies as part of the registration or incorporation process.

column.name: organization_name
column.remarks: The name of the client.

column.name: client_type_code
column.remarks: A code representing the type of a client.

column.name: good_standing_ind
column.remarks: An indicator that determines whether a client is in good standing with respect to their financial obligations.

column.name: birthdate
column.remarks: The date that the BC Services Card logged in person was born.

column.name: district_code
column.remarks: A code representing the natural resource district of a client.

column.name: work_safe_bc_number
column.remarks: A Work Safe BC number of a client.

column.name: doing_business_as
column.remarks: An alternate name that a client may be conducting business under. For example: John Smith doing business as: John's Logging.

column.name: client_acronym
column.remarks: A familiar alphabetic acronym to be used as an alternative to the ministry's client number for data entry and display.

column.name: first_name
column.remarks: The first name of the client.

column.name: middle_name
column.remarks: The middle name of the client.

column.name: last_name
column.remarks: The last name of the client.

column.name: notes
column.remarks: Any additional information about the client or specific instructions.

column.name: identification_type_code
column.remarks: A code indicating the identification type of a client.

column.name: client_identification
column.remarks: The reference number that identifies a client.

column.name: identification_country_code
column.remarks: A code representing the code of a country.

column.name: identification_province_code
column.remarks: A code representing the code of a province, state, department or territory.

table.name: submission_location
table.remarks: The details of a client's location.

column.name: submission_location_id
column.remarks: Incremental id generated for a location of a client.

column.name: submission_id
column.remarks: Incremental id generated for a submission of a client.

column.name: street_address
column.remarks: The address of a client, including the street number and street name.

column.name: country_code
column.remarks: A code representing the code of a country.

column.name: province_code
column.remarks: A code representing the code of a province, state, department or territory.

column.name: city_name
column.remarks: The name of the city of the location.

column.name: location_name
column.remarks: The location name of an address. Examples of location names include, but are not limited to, Mailing Address, Billing Address among others.

column.name: business_phone_number
column.remarks: The phone number of a client's specific location.

column.name: secondary_phone_number
column.remarks: A secondary phone number of a client's specific location.

column.name: fax_number
column.remarks: The fax number of a client's specific location.

column.name: notes
column.remarks: Any additional information about the client's location or specific instructions for contacting them.

column.name: complementary_address_1
column.remarks: A complementary address line of a client

column.name: complementary_address_2
column.remarks: A second complementary address line of a client

column.name: email_address
column.remarks: The email address of the client's location.

table.name: submission_location_contact_xref
table.remarks: Identifies the multiple addresses for a given client, as well as the many contacts that may belong to a given address.

column.name: submission_location_id
column.remarks: Incremental id generated for a location of a client.

column.name: submission_contact_id
column.remarks: Incremental id generated for the contact details of a client.

table.name: submission_matching_detail
table.remarks: The number of matches, if any, found in the legacy oracle database. These matches are determined through a combination of fuzzy search in specific fields and exact equality in others.

column.name: submission_matching_detail_id
column.remarks: Incremental id generated for a submission matching detail of a client.

column.name: submission_id
column.remarks: Incremental id generated for a submission of a client.

column.name: matching_fields
column.remarks: A JSON object provides information about matches found in the existing database. The matches can result from fuzzy search, like matching a name pattern, or from exact equality, such as matching incorporation number or good standing status.

column.name: confirmed_match_status_ind
column.remarks: An indicator that determines whether a specific match has been approved, allowing the processing to continue, or denied, requiring immediate action to be taken during the submission process.

column.name: confirmed_match_message
column.remarks: A field with the reason for the denial of the submission.

column.name: confirmed_match_timestamp
column.remarks: The timestamp when the changes happened.

column.name: confirmed_match_userid
column.remarks: The ID of the user submitting the changes.

column.name: submission_matching_processed
column.remarks: A flag to indicate that the submission was finally processed.

column.name: submission_matching_processed_time
column.remarks: The timestamp of when the processor started to process this specific entry

table.name: submission_status_code
table.remarks: A code indicating the status of a client creation submission request. Examples of possible statuses include Approved, Rejected, and others.

column.name: submission_status_code
column.remarks: A code representing the status of a submission request.

column.name: description
column.remarks: The description of the code value.

column.name: effective_date
column.remarks: The date that the code value has become or is expected to become effective. Default is the data that the code value is created.

column.name: expiry_date
column.remarks: The date on which the code value has expired or is expected to expire. Default 9999-12-31.

column.name: create_timestamp
column.remarks: The date and time the record was created.

column.name: update_timestamp
column.remarks: The date and time the record was created or last updated.

column.name: create_user
column.remarks: The user or proxy account that created the record.

column.name: update_user
column.remarks: The user or proxy account that created or last updated the record.

column.name: expiry_date
column.remarks: The date on which the code value has expired or is expected to expire. Default 9999-12-31.
